The app is designed to be compatible with a range of Xiaomi Smart Fans. The following models should be supported:

 • Pedestal Fan P9
 • Pedestal Fan P10
 • Mija Pedestal Fan
 • Pedestal Fan P15
 • Mi Smart Standing Fan 2
 • Mi Smart Standing Fan 2 Pro

 Please Note: While the app is designed to work with all the models listed above, it has only been physically tested on the Mi Smart Standing Fan 2 Pro. Functionality with other models is based on the protocol implementation from the 'python-miio' library and is not guaranteed.

Welcome to SmartHR FanControl! This guide will help you set up the app in a few simple steps.\n\n Step 1: Obtain Fan IP Address and Token\n To control your Xiaomi fan, the app needs its local IP address and a unique 32-character token. Since this app is not affiliated with Xiaomi, you need to retrieve this information yourself using open-source tools.\n\n A highly recommended and user-friendly tool for this is the "Xiaomi Cloud Tokens Extractor". You can find it by searching online or visiting its GitHub page. Simply log in with your Xiaomi/Mi Home account, and the tool will display the IP and Token for all your devices.\n\n Step 2: Configure the Fan in the App\n 1. Navigate to the Settings tab (the gear icon).\n 2. In the "Fan Config" section, enter the IP Address and Token you obtained in the previous step.\n 3. Tap the SAVE FAN SETTINGS button. The app will attempt to connect. If successful, the fan status on the Main screen will change to "Connected".\n\n Step 3: Pair Your Heart Rate Sensor\n 1. Navigate to the HR Sensors tab (the Bluetooth icon).\n 2. Tap the SEARCH HEART RATE SENSORS button. The app will scan for nearby BLE heart rate devices for 10 seconds.\n 3. New devices will appear under "Detected Devices". Tap Pair to add a sensor to your saved list.\n 4. Once a device is paired, it will appear in the "Paired Sensors" list. Tap Select to make it the active sensor for the app.\n\n Step 4: Configure Auto Mode (Optional)\n The app comes with sensible default settings, but you can customize them in the Settings -> Auto Mode tab.\n • Heart Rate Range: Defines your effort zone. Below HR Min, the fan runs at minimum speed; above HR Max, at maximum speed.\n • Fan Speed Range: Sets the minimum and maximum speed limits for Auto Mode.\n • Exponent & Smoothing: Advanced settings to control how quickly and smoothly the fan reacts to changes in your heart rate. You can learn more by tapping the (i) icon next to each setting.\n After making changes, remember to tap SAVE AUTO MODE SETTINGS.\n\n Step 5: Start Controlling!\n You are now ready to go!\n 1. On the Main screen (the home icon), first turn the fan on using the main FAN ON button at the bottom.\n 2. To activate automatic control, toggle the Auto Mode switch. The fan speed will now adjust automatically based on your heart rate.\n 3. To control the speed manually, make sure Auto Mode is off and use the slider.\n\n Enjoy your workout! \n\nVisual Guide with Screenshots\n For a more detailed, visual guide with screenshots, please visit the project\'s official GitHub page:\n https://github.com/chudzik28/SmartHR-FanControl

 Thank you for using SmartHR FanControl. Your privacy is critically important to us.

 1. Data Collection and Use
 This application is a hobby project and operates on a principle of "zero data collection." We do not collect, store, or transmit any personal or usage data to the developer or any third party. The application does not contain advertisements or any form of analytics tracking.

 2. Data Storage and Security
 To function, the application requires you to provide sensitive information, such as your fan's IP address and token, as well as the MAC addresses of your Bluetooth heart rate sensors. All of this data is stored exclusively on your device. We use Android's Jetpack Security library (EncryptedSharedPreferences) to encrypt this data, ensuring it is protected and inaccessible to other applications.

 3. Heart Rate (Biometric) Data
 The application receives heart rate data from your chosen Bluetooth sensor in real-time to control your fan. This biometric data is processed entirely on your device and is never stored, logged, or transmitted off your device by the application.

 The "Heart Rate Sharing" feature allows you to re-broadcast your heart rate as a standard Bluetooth HR peripheral. Enabling this feature is your choice and responsibility. The application only facilitates this broadcast; it does not monitor or record where this data is sent.

 4. Permissions
 The application requires certain permissions to function (e.g., Wi-Fi and Bluetooth access). These permissions are used exclusively for the application's core functionality: discovering and communicating with your HR sensor and fan, and optionally, re-broadcasting your heart rate.

 5. Third-Party Services
 The application includes a link to "Buy Me a Coffee" for voluntary support. If you choose to use this link, you will be redirected to a third-party website. Your interaction with that website is governed by their own privacy policy and terms of service.

 6. Changes to This Privacy Policy
 We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy within the application.
